0.0: Remember, LORD, what has occurred to us, Alas! Look and see our disgrace. Alas! what has occurred to us.
0.1: Our property has been handed over to strangers, Alas! Our homes to foreigners. Alas! what has occurred to us.
0.2: We have become orphans without a father. Alas! Our mothers mourn in the month of Av. Alas! what has occurred to us.
0.3: We had to purchase water to drink. Alas! Because we abused the water libation. Alas! what has occurred to us.
0.4: We had yokes put on our necks, Alas! Because we hatefully persecuted others. Alas! what has occurred to us.
0.5: To the Egyptians we stretched out our hand, Alas! And the Assyrians trapped us like a hunter. Alas! what has occurred to us.
0.6: Our ancestors have sinned and are no more, Alas! And we suffer for their sins. Alas! what has occurred to us.
0.7: Slaves rule over us, Alas! Because we did not release our slaves. Alas! what has occurred to us.
0.8: We risk our lives to get our bread. Alas! Because we closed our hands to the needy. Alas! what has occurred to us.
0.9: Our skin has shriveled as from the heat of an oven. Alas! Because they exchanged their honour for disgrace. Alas! what has occurred to us.
0.10: They tortured the women of Zion. Alas! Because we violated our friends wives. Alas! what has occurred to us.
0.11: Princes were hung by their hands. Alas! Because they were violent and robbed the poor. Alas! what has occurred to us.
0.12: Our young men were forced to carry millstone. Alas! Because they were found in the houses of harlots. Alas! what has occurred to us.
0.13: The elders ceased to be at the city gates. Alas! Because they perverted the judgements against the orphan and widow. Alas! what has occurred to us.
0.14: The joy in our heart has ceased, Alas! Because we annulled our pilgrimages to the Temple. Alas! what has occurred to us.
0.15: The crown has fallen from our head, Alas! Because our Holy Temple has burnt down. Alas! what has occurred to us.
0.16: It is due to this that we became faint hearted, Alas! Because the honour of our beloved House has been removed. Alas! what has occurred to us.
0.17: For Mount Zion has become desolate, Alas! Because we have placed an abomination on it. Alas! what has occurred to us.
0.18: For You, LORD, shall reign forever, for Your throne endures from generation to generation.
0.19: Why have You forgotten us for ever and forsaken us for so long?
0.20: Return us to You, LORD, and we will return. renew our days as of old.
0.21: For if You utterly despised us, with a exceedingly furious anger against us.
0.22: Return us to You, LORD, and we will return. renew our days as of old.

16.0: If women could eat the fruit of their womb, the little babes clapping their hands...
16.2: If women so full of compassion could boil their children, measured hand height by hand height...
16.4: If the fine locks of their heads could be shorn and bound as decorations for horses...
16.6: If the tongue of a nursing baby could glue to his palate from blinding white thirst...
16.8: If one could sigh one to another: "Come on and let's boil our screeching sons...
16.10: If one could ask of another: "Give over your son to eat" but he's already hidden, sliced into slices...
16.12: If fathers, now meat, could be seasoned for their sons in caves and trenches...
16.14: If daughters could be dandled in the breasts of their mothers, distended bellies...
16.16: If the ghosts of children, bloated with rot, floated in the streets of the city...

18.0: Yours, my Lord, is the righteousness, because of the wondrous signs You have displayed from then until now;
18.1: and ours is the shamefacedness, because of the trial with which You sought to refine us, (but as a result of our failure) You despised us.
18.2: Yours, my Lord, is the righteousness because You have taken (our) nation from amidst another nation, with miracles;
18.3: and ours is the shamefacedness, because of the hypocrisy to be found within us as we emulated (Egypt's abominable) deeds.
18.4: Yours, my Lord, is the righteousness because God went out to redeem us as a people unto Himself;
18.5: and ours is the shamefacedness, because they (our forefathers) rebelled on the shore of the Sea of reeds, the nation sinning against its God!
18.6: Yours, my Lord, is the righteousness when we recall the proclamation, 'You are witnesses, and I am God!'
18.7: and, ours is the shamefacedness, because we blasphemed Hashem in (the Wilderness of) Sin (when we demanded of Aaron), 'Arise and create a god for us!'
18.8: Yours, my Lord, is the righteousness because You fed us (the manna) that tasted like dough fried in honey;
18.9: and ours, is the shamefacedness, because on the day (we made the Golden Calf), we brought it an offering of fine flour with oil and honey.
18.10: Yours, my Lord, is the righteousness because you provided us with the manna, the well and the pillar of clouds;
18.11: and ours is the shamefacedness because our forefathers grumbled in their tents about (the manna and called it) the destructive bread.
18.12: Yours, my Lord, is the righteousness because in the wilderness we lacked for nothing;
18.13: and ours is the shamefacedness because we defied You as Laban, Hazeroth, and Di-zahab as related (by Moses),
18.14: Yours, my Lord, is the righteousness because of (how You waged war for us with) Sihon and Og and all the kings of Canaan;
18.15: and ours is the shamefacedness because of Achan who appropriated for himself from the forbidden spoils (of Jericho) and found no excuse (for his crime).
18.16: Yours, my Lord, is the righteousness because of all that You accomplished through the fourteen saviors(-Judges);
18.17: and ours is the shamefacedness because of Micah's idol through which we transgressed.
18.18: Yours, my Lord, is the righteousness because You erected (Tabernacles) at Shiloh, Nob, Gibeon and the Eternal Temple (in Jerusalem);
18.19: and ours is the shamefacedness because the evil in our midst caused each one's destruction, and in their loss, we have been humiliated.
18.20: Yours, my Lord, is the righteousness because although the Destructions of the two Temples were caused by our corruption, we ourselves were spared;
18.21: and ours is the shamefacedness because we should have repented to You wholeheartedly so that You would return to us in compassion.
18.22: Yours, my Lord, is the righteousness because of the (almost) nine centuries throughout which You withheld Your anger (over our sins) and didn't broadcast it;
18.23: and ours is the shamefacedness because (Daniel) the man of delights pleaded with You (to end the Babylonian Exile after a mere seventy years, even though we were not worthy,) saying, 'Incline Your ear, O my God, and hear!'

44.0: Mourn for Zion and her cities, like a woman giving birth, like a maiden wrapped in sack-cloth for the husband of her youth
44.1: Mourn for the palace that was abandoned like a sheep’s negligence of its flock,
44.2: and for the entry of God’s blasphemers into her holy sanctuary.
44.3: Mourn for God’s exiled servants who beautifully sang her songs,
44.4: and for their blood that was spilled like the waters of her rivers.
44.5: Mourn for the chatter of her dancers whose silence fills her cities,
44.6: and for the assembly that was destroyed and the abolition of her  Sanhedrin.
44.7: Mourn for the daily sacrifices and the redemption of her firstborn,
44.8: and for the desecration of the Temple vessels and the altar of her incense.
44.9: Mourn for the babes of her kings, noble children of David,
44.10: and for their beauty that was darkened at the time of the removal of her crowns.
44.11: Mourn for the glory that was dispelled at the time of the  destruction of her Holy of Holies,
44.12: and for the oppressor who tormented her whilst girding her in sackcloth.
44.13: Mourn for the wounds and the many blows that struck her sainted ones,
44.14: and for the smashing on the rock of her young children.
44.15: Mourn for the joy of her haters who rejoiced over her downfall,
44.16: and for the torment of her pure and noble citizens.
44.17: Mourn for the sins that caused her to deviate from the true path,
44.18: and for her numerous congregations, which were tarnished and blackened.
44.19: Mourn for the voices of her abusers as her rising corpses mounted,
44.20: and for the jeering mobs within her holy courtyards.
44.21: Mourn for Your name which was desecrated in the mouths of those who stand against her,
44.22: and for their prayers which they cry out to you, heed and hear her words....
44.23: Mourn for Zion and her cities, like a woman giving birth, like a maiden wrapped in sack-cloth for the husband of her youth
